decks.notes: The main concept of this control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. The deck includes a variety of efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Card selection and manipulation with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to find answers and maintain card advantage. The deck also includes win conditions like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Council's Judgment to close out the game once the opponent is sufficiently controlled.

The deck is centered around using lands to control the game, utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful tokens. It also includes control elements like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to grind out an advantage over time with cards like Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire, while also having the flexibility to tutor for key lands with Crop Rotation and Gamble. Ultimately, the strategy revolves around using lands to generate incremental advantages and out-value the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat, quickly reducing its own life total to make it a formidable attacker. It also includes disruption and removal spells to control the opponent's board while using cards like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is streamlined to efficiently cast the spells needed to support the main game plan of playing aggressive threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win quickly and decisively through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck also aims to capitalize on card advantage and deck manipulation through cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Snapcaster Mage. It seeks to establish a strong board presence with the help of creatures like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while also leveraging the powerful sweepers of Terminus and Supreme Verdict to punish aggressive strategies. Finally, the deck looks to lockdown the opponent's mana base with Back to Basics and Counterbalance.

The deck focuses on aggressive play and tempo control, using cards like Nimble Mongoose, Delver of Secrets, and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Daze and Stifle to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly establish board control and protect its threats with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. With its efficient spells and creatures, the deck aims to close out the game quickly while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes mana acceleration from lands like Eldrazi Temple and City of Traitors to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a stream of large threats while using disruptive elements to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with removal spells like Diabolic Edict, Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Kolaghan's Command. It also aims to control the game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil, while generating card advantage and value with cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace its opponent with a combination of disruption, removal, and card advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's strategies while using Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull. It also utilizes strong interactive spells like Swords to Plowshares, Force of Will, and Flusterstorm to maintain board control and protect key threats. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor adds another dimension to the control aspect of the deck, while creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique provide additional threats and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of efficient removal and potent threats.

The main focus of this deck is to take advantage of the powerful Death's Shadow creature, which becomes bigger as your life total decreases. This aggressive strategy is supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, as well as efficient removal like Fatal Push and Snuff Out. The deck also includes card draw and filtering with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to help find Death's Shadow and other key cards quickly. The mana base is focused on fetching crucial dual lands and utilizing Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana bases.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to cheat out big threats early, combined with disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong offensive presence. Cards like Reality Smasher and Endbringer provide powerful threats that are difficult for opponents to deal with, while Wasteland helps to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck focuses on early aggression and disruption to take control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent with counter spells and removal, while also generating card advantage through card draw and recursion. The deck aims to efficiently answer threats with a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, as well as powerful lines of play with cards like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. This Grixis Control deck utilizes a strong combination of card advantage and disruption to stay ahead of the opponent and secure a victory through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's resources while generating card advantage through powerful spells like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also uses efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Diabolic Edict to deal with threats, while utilizing cards like Baleful Strix and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain board presence and card advantage. With a mix of hand disruption, card draw, and removal, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and ultimately establish control over the game.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting their game plan with disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, using cards like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland to control the board and secure victory quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Flexibility in the form of cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder helps the deck find the right cards to execute its game plan effectively.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on deploying threats early and aggressively disrupting the opponent's game plan with efficient countermagic and hand disruption spells. The deck aims to control the board through a combination of creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. The deck plays a tempo game, utilizing cards like Daze and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and maintain pressure on the board. The deck's main goal is to apply pressure and close out the game quickly.

This deck aims to control the game by countering and removing the opponent's threats while slowly gaining advantage with card draw and selection. The key strategy revolves around using counter spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's plans. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with problematic creatures. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte adds flexibility and resilience to the deck. Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis provide additional threats that can quickly close out the game.

This deck is focused on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay, utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Bomat Courier to deal damage quickly. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent. The deck's mana denial plan with cards like Wasteland and Stifle helps to keep the opponent off balance, while also providing the deck with some tempo advantage. Overall, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the game.
